easy: Master MERN stack fundamentals - React + Node.js + MongoDB
Build 2-3 full-stack CRUD projects for your portfolio
Practice basic DSA - arrays, strings, and simple algorithms
doable: Complete at least 3 full-stack projects with authentication
Solve 60+ LeetCode problems focusing on easy-medium
Deploy your projects on Vercel/Render with live demos
challenging: Build production-quality full-stack apps with testing
DSA practice is important - aim for 80+ problems
Demonstrate both frontend and backend expertise in interviews
stretch: Plan for 8-10 months of focused full-stack preparation
Master both frontend and backend thoroughly
Strong referrals and bootcamp credentials will help significantly

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 2-3 coding problems covering JavaScript, data structures, and basic algorithms
Common topics: arrays, strings, objects, async operations, and API handling
May include MCQs on full-stack concepts: React, Node.js, databases
Focus on writing clean, functional code within time limits

rounds.name: Full-Stack Machine Coding
points: Build a mini full-stack application: Todo app, expense tracker, or blog platform
Implement both frontend (React) and backend (Node.js/Express) with database
Must include CRUD operations, basic authentication, and API integration
Code quality, architecture, and working functionality are all evaluated

rounds.name: Technical Interview (Backend)
points: Node.js and Express fundamentals: routing, middleware, error handling
Database questions: MongoDB queries, schema design, or SQL basics
REST API design: best practices, status codes, authentication
Live coding: implement an API endpoint with validation and error handling

rounds.name: Technical Interview (Frontend + DSA)
points: React fundamentals: components, hooks, state management, useEffect
1-2 DSA problems (easy to medium): arrays, strings, or hash maps
JavaScript core concepts: async/await, promises, closures, this keyword
Discuss your full-stack projects and technical decisions you made

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Cultural Fit
points: Career transition story: why you switched to tech and chose full-stack
Discussion about your bootcamp/self-learning journey and key projects
Behavioral questions on collaboration, learning agility, and problem-solving
Ask about mentorship, team culture, and growth opportunities for career switchers

easy: Build 3-4 impressive full-stack projects with authentication and deployment
Practice DSA regularly - solve 70+ problems across patterns
Strengthen both React and Node.js fundamentals
doable: Create production-quality MERN apps with testing and CI/CD
Solve 100+ DSA problems - focus on medium difficulty
Demonstrate full-stack expertise through well-documented GitHub projects
challenging: Build complex full-stack apps: real-time features, payment integration, etc.
DSA is crucial - aim for 120+ problems with optimal solutions
Referrals are highly valuable - network through bootcamp alumni and LinkedIn
stretch: Plan for 8-12 months of intensive preparation
Master both frontend and backend at production-level quality
Strong bootcamp credentials and referrals are almost essential

rounds.name: Online Assessment
points: 3-4 coding problems ranging from easy to medium difficulty
Focus on JavaScript problem-solving and algorithmic thinking
May include frontend-specific challenges (DOM manipulation, async operations)
Passing score typically 60-70% to proceed to interviews

rounds.name: DSA Round 1
points: 1-2 medium problems on arrays, strings, or hash maps
Expected to arrive at optimal solution with hints
Code on shared editors like CoderPad or HackerRank
Interviewer evaluates problem-solving approach and communication

rounds.name: DSA Round 2 / Frontend Fundamentals
points: Could be another DSA round or deep dive into JavaScript internals
Topics: closures, prototypes, event loop, promises, this keyword
Questions on React: virtual DOM, reconciliation, hooks, performance
Write code to demonstrate concepts (e.g., implement Promise.all)

rounds.name: Machine Coding / UI Round
points: Build a real-world component: search with autocomplete, pagination, filters
Use React or vanilla JavaScript based on company preference
Focus on code organization, reusability, and edge case handling
Bonus points for responsive design and accessibility considerations

rounds.name: Hiring Manager / Bar Raiser
points: Behavioral questions using STAR format (Situation, Task, Action, Result)
Deep dive into your best project - technical decisions and trade-offs
Questions about handling challenges, tight deadlines, and collaboration
Culture fit assessment - research company values beforehand

easy: Master MERN stack basics - React, Node.js, Express, MongoDB
Build 2-3 simple full-stack projects with CRUD operations
Practice basic coding problems and web fundamentals
doable: Complete full-stack bootcamp curriculum or equivalent self-learning
Build at least 2 deployable full-stack applications
Practice explaining your projects and technical concepts clearly
challenging: Demonstrate solid understanding of both frontend and backend
Have polished projects on GitHub with README documentation
Focus on clear communication - explain your career transition story well
stretch: Service companies are very entry-friendly for bootcamp graduates
Emphasize your willingness to learn and adapt
This is the most achievable path for non-tech career switchers

rounds.name: Aptitude & Online Test
points: Quantitative aptitude, logical reasoning, and verbal ability
1-2 easy coding problems (basic loops, conditionals, arrays)
MCQs on HTML, CSS, JavaScript basics
Focus on accuracy over speed - cutoff-based filtering

rounds.name: Technical Interview 1
points: Questions on HTML tags, CSS selectors, and JavaScript syntax
Explain concepts: var vs let vs const, event delegation, box model
Simple coding: reverse a string, find duplicates in array
Project discussion - be ready to explain your contributions clearly

rounds.name: Technical Interview 2
points: Deeper dive into JavaScript: closures, hoisting, callbacks
Basic React questions if it's on your resume: JSX, props, state
May ask to build a simple layout or debug existing code
Focus on fundamentals - breadth over depth

rounds.name: HR Interview
points: Standard questions: strengths, weaknesses, why this company
Career goals and willingness to learn new technologies
Salary expectations (be realistic for fresher roles)
Relocation flexibility and notice period discussion

easy: Build exceptional full-stack projects demonstrating scale and complexity
Practice DSA intensively - solve 150+ problems with optimal solutions
Prepare for both frontend and backend system design discussions
doable: DSA mastery is critical - aim for 180+ LeetCode problems (medium/hard)
Build production-quality full-stack apps with advanced features
Strong referrals through bootcamp network or LinkedIn are very helpful
challenging: Expert-level DSA required - 200+ problems with complex patterns
Demonstrate deep understanding of full-stack architecture and trade-offs
Referrals are almost essential - leverage every connection
stretch: This is extremely challenging for entry-level non-tech backgrounds
Plan for 12+ months of intensive preparation
Strongly consider gaining 1-2 years of experience at other companies first

rounds.name: Recruiter Screen
points: Initial call to verify your background and interest
Overview of the interview process and timeline
Questions about visa status, location preferences, start date
Opportunity to ask about the team and role expectations

rounds.name: Phone/Online Technical Screen
points: 1-2 coding problems on shared editor (CoderPad, Google Docs)
Medium difficulty - arrays, strings, hash maps, or trees
Focus on clean code, edge cases, and optimal time complexity
Strong communication is essential - think out loud throughout

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 1
points: Medium to hard DSA problem with live whiteboard or code editor
Common topics: dynamic programming, trees, graphs, recursion
Interviewer evaluates problem breakdown and optimization
Expect follow-up questions to extend or modify your solution

rounds.name: Onsite: Coding Round 2
points: Another DSA problem, potentially harder or different domain
May involve advanced data structures or complex logic
Write clean, bug-free code under time pressure
Discuss multiple approaches before settling on implementation

rounds.name: Onsite: Frontend System Design
points: Design a frontend system: autocomplete, infinite scroll, feed
Cover component architecture, state management, API design
Discuss performance: lazy loading, code splitting, caching
Address accessibility, error handling, and edge cases

rounds.name: Onsite: Behavioral / Googleyness
points: Amazon: Leadership Principles with STAR format
Google: Googleyness - collaboration, growth mindset, adaptability
Prepare stories about ownership, conflict, learning from failure
Questions like 'Tell me about a time you had to learn something new quickly'

rounds.name: Hiring Committee & Team Match
points: Google: Packet reviewed by hiring committee for final decision
Amazon: Bar raiser provides independent assessment
Team matching calls to find mutual fit
Process can take 2-4 weeks post-onsite

projects.title: Full-Stack Blog Platform (MERN)
projects.description: Build a complete blog platform with user authentication, create/edit/delete posts, and comments using MERN stack
projects.shortDescription: MERN blog with authentication and CRUD operations
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-quality blog platform using the MERN stack (MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js). Users can register/login, create posts with rich text, edit their own posts, delete posts, and add comments. This foundational full-stack project teaches authentication, CRUD operations, REST API design, and connecting frontend to backend - all essential skills for full-stack development.

implementationSteps.title: Backend Setup - Express Server & Database
implementationSteps.description: Create Node.js project with Express. Set up MongoDB connection using Mongoose. Design schemas for User (username, email, password hash) and Post (title, content, author, createdAt, comments). Install dependencies: express, mongoose, bcryptjs, jsonwebtoken, dotenv. Set up environment variables for database URL and JWT secret.

implementationSteps.title: Authentication APIs
implementationSteps.description: Build /api/auth/register endpoint: validate input, hash password with bcrypt, save user to database. Build /api/auth/login endpoint: verify credentials, generate JWT token, return token to client. Create authentication middleware to verify JWT tokens and protect routes. Test endpoints with Postman.

implementationSteps.title: Posts CRUD APIs
implementationSteps.description: Create POST /api/posts (protected): create new blog post with authenticated user as author. Create GET /api/posts: fetch all posts with author details populated. Create PUT /api/posts/:id (protected): update post if user is the author. Create DELETE /api/posts/:id (protected): delete post if user is the author. Implement error handling for all routes.

implementationSteps.title: React Frontend - Auth & Routing
implementationSteps.description: Set up React with React Router. Create Login and Register pages with forms. On successful login/register, store JWT in localStorage. Create AuthContext to manage authentication state globally. Implement protected routes that redirect to login if not authenticated. Build Navbar with login/logout functionality.

implementationSteps.title: Frontend - Blog Features & Deployment
implementationSteps.description: Create Home page to fetch and display all posts. Build CreatePost page with rich text editor (or simple textarea). Implement EditPost page with pre-filled form. Add delete functionality with confirmation modal. Connect all frontend components to backend APIs using fetch/axios. Style with Tailwind CSS. Deploy backend to Render/Railway and frontend to Vercel. Add environment variables for production API URL.

projects.title: Task Management App with Teams (MERN)
projects.description: Build a collaborative task manager where users can create tasks, assign to team members, track progress, and filter by status/priority
projects.shortDescription: MERN task manager with user roles and real-time updates
projects.fullDescription: Create an advanced task management application using MERN stack with user authentication, role-based access (admin/member), task assignment, status tracking (todo/in-progress/done), priority levels, and filtering. This intermediate project teaches complex state management, relational data modeling, authorization logic, and building collaborative features - skills needed for real-world SaaS applications.

implementationSteps.title: Backend - Schema Design & Auth
implementationSteps.description: Design MongoDB schemas: User (name, email, password, role: admin/member), Team (name, members[], createdBy), Task (title, description, assignedTo, status, priority, dueDate, team). Set up Express server with authentication middleware. Implement register/login with JWT. Create team creation endpoint (only for admins).

implementationSteps.title: Backend - Task & Team APIs
implementationSteps.description: Build POST /api/teams: create team and add members. Build GET /api/teams/:id/tasks: fetch all tasks for a team. Build POST /api/tasks: create task (validate user is team member). Build PATCH /api/tasks/:id: update task status/priority. Build GET /api/tasks with query filters: ?status=done&priority=high. Implement authorization checks.

implementationSteps.title: Frontend - Auth & Team Setup
implementationSteps.description: Build registration/login flow with JWT storage. Create Dashboard layout with sidebar navigation. Build Teams page: display user's teams, create new team (admin only), invite members via email. Use React Context for global auth and team state. Create reusable Card and Button components.

implementationSteps.title: Frontend - Task Management UI
implementationSteps.description: Build Kanban board view with columns: To Do, In Progress, Done. Implement drag-and-drop using react-beautiful-dnd (optional) or simple status update buttons. Create TaskCard component showing title, assignee, priority badge, due date. Build CreateTask modal with form: title, description, assign dropdown, priority, due date. Implement real-time status updates.

implementationSteps.title: Advanced Features & Deploy
implementationSteps.description: Add search/filter functionality: filter by assignee, priority, status, or search by task title. Implement notifications when assigned to a task (email or in-app). Add task comments/activity log (bonus). Style with Tailwind CSS using modern design. Deploy to Render (backend) + Vercel (frontend) with environment variables. Add comprehensive README with screenshots.

projects.title: E-Commerce Store with Payments (MERN)
projects.description: Build a complete e-commerce platform with product listings, shopping cart, checkout, payment integration (Stripe/Razorpay), and order management
projects.shortDescription: Full-stack e-commerce with cart, payments, and admin dashboard
projects.fullDescription: Create a production-grade e-commerce application using MERN stack with user authentication, product browsing, shopping cart, checkout flow, payment gateway integration (Stripe or Razorpay), order tracking, and admin dashboard for product management. This advanced project demonstrates end-to-end full-stack development, payment processing, state management, and building a complete commercial application - portfolio centerpiece quality.

implementationSteps.title: Backend - Product & User Schemas
implementationSteps.description: Design MongoDB schemas: Product (name, description, price, images[], category, stock, ratings), User (name, email, password, isAdmin), Order (user, items[], totalAmount, paymentStatus, shippingAddress, orderStatus). Set up Express with Mongoose. Implement JWT authentication with admin role checking. Create image upload endpoint using Multer + Cloudinary for product images.

implementationSteps.title: Backend - Products & Cart APIs
implementationSteps.description: Build GET /api/products: fetch all products with pagination and filtering by category/price. Build GET /api/products/:id: get single product details. Build POST /api/products (admin only): create product with image upload. Build PATCH /api/products/:id (admin): update product. Build DELETE /api/products/:id (admin): delete product. Implement cart in frontend state or build cart APIs for persistence.

implementationSteps.title: Backend - Payment & Order Processing
implementationSteps.description: Integrate Stripe or Razorpay: install SDK, create checkout session endpoint. Build POST /api/orders: create order after successful payment, update product stock. Build GET /api/orders/myorders: fetch user's order history. Build GET /api/orders/:id: get order details with tracking. Implement webhook to handle payment confirmations. Add email notifications using Nodemailer (optional).

implementationSteps.title: Frontend - Product Catalog & Cart
implementationSteps.description: Build Home page with product grid fetching from API. Implement ProductCard with image, name, price, 'Add to Cart' button. Create ProductDetail page with image gallery, description, stock status. Build shopping cart using React Context: add to cart, update quantity, remove items, persist to localStorage. Create CartSidebar with item list, subtotal calculation, and checkout button. Style with Tailwind CSS.

implementationSteps.title: Frontend - Checkout, Payments & Admin Dashboard
implementationSteps.description: Build multi-step checkout: (1) Shipping address form, (2) Payment method selection, (3) Order review. Integrate Stripe/Razorpay frontend: create payment form, handle success/failure. Build OrderConfirmation page showing order details. Create admin dashboard: login, product management (CRUD table), view all orders with status updates. Deploy backend to Render/Railway, frontend to Vercel. Secure API keys with environment variables. Add comprehensive demo video and README.
